interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Scooby-Doo, Where Are You!: Complete Series
Review Date: 2013/05/21
Store: Don Messick  (Actor),     Casey Kasem  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Characters & Series, Scooby Doo
Product Description: ["Limited edition set contains all 41 episodes of the 3 season television series. Hanna- Barbera series featuring Scooby Doo, a dog who joins Velma, Daphne, Freddie, and Shaggy on many quests to solve mysterious. Each mystery is new and unusual and involves the group stopping someone from wreaking certain havoc on the world. Scooby-Doo was a large, loveable but cowardly Great Dane who hung around four California high school students (Fred, Velma, Daphne and Shaggy). The four teen-agers were in constant search of mysteries and adventures, driving around in a bright green van known as the Mystery Machine. Many of the group's adventures involved villians who took on supernatural disguises (ghosts and monsters); the villians' activities usually involved blackmail, theft, fraud and other forms of corruption. At the first hint of trouble, Scooby-Doo (and usually, Shaggy as well) running for cover; they usually found themselves in even deeper trouble. It usually took the promise of a Scooby snack to get Scooby (and Shaggy) to come out of hiding. The mysteries were always solved by the end of each show."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation, Comedy, Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Box set, Color, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Casey Kasem, Joe Ruby, Don Messick, Larz Bourne, Joseph Barbera, Bill Lutz, Frank Welker, Ken Spears, William Hanna, Nicole Jaffe, Tom DagenaisCasey Kasem, Joe Ruby, Don Messick, Larz Bourne, Joseph Barbera, Bill Lutz, Frank Welker, Ken Spears, William Hanna, Nicole Jaffe, Tom Dagenais  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '8', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.22 Pounds', 'Item model number': '9934437', 'Director': 'Joseph Barbera, William Hanna', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Box set, Color, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '15 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 13, 2012', 'Actors': 'Don Messick, Casey Kasem, Frank Welker, Nicole Jaffe', 'Producers': 'Joseph Barbera, William Hanna', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Bill Lutz, Joe Ruby, Ken Spears, Larz Bourne, Tom Dagenais', 'Number of discs': '8'}
Review Text: It comes in this nice cardboard box seen in the picture.  I love Scooby-doo and am looking forward to watching these over the years.  I am not enough of an expert to be able to tell you if everything is present, etc.
Review Title: I had to have this...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ralph Hemecker', 'Ron Underwood', 'Dean White', 'Romeo Tirone', 'Steve Pearlman', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Billy Gierhart', 'David Solomon', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Alrick Riley'], 'Studio': ['ABC']}
I had accidentally deleted this episode from my dvr and the rest of the series kept recording, but I couldn't watch it until I had watched this one.  We couldn't find it anywhere for free and finally bought it on Amazon.  It was fast and good quality.
You need this episode to keep going in the series
The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (Blu-ray)
Ian McKellen  (Actor),     Martin Freeman  (Actor),     Peter Jackson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
['The adventure follows the journey of title character Bilbo Baggins, who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug. Approached out of the blue by the wizard Gandalf the Grey, Bilbo finds himself joining a company of thirteen dwarves led by the legendary warrior, Thorin Oakenshield. Their journey will take them into the Wild; through treacherous lands swarming with Goblins and Orcs, deadly Wargs and Sorcerers. Although their goal lies to the East and the wastelands of the Lonely Mountain, first they must escape the goblin tunnels, where Bilbo meets the creature that will change his life forever Gollum. Here, alone with Gollum, on the shores of an underground lake, the unassuming Bilbo Baggins not only discovers depths of ingenuity and courage that surprise even him, he also gains possession of Gollum\'s "precious" ring that holds unexpected and useful qualities A simple, gold ring that is tied to the fate of all Middle-earth in ways Bilbo cannot begin to know. ©2013 Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. THE HOBBIT: AN UNEXPECTED JOURNEY and THE HOBBIT, names of the characters, items, events and places therein are trademarks of The Saul Zaentz Company d/b/a Middle-earth Enterprises under license to New Line Productions, Inc. All rights reserved.']
{'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Blu-ray, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Elijah Wood, Ken Stott, Christopher Lee, Hugo Weaving, Andy Serkis, Peter Jackson, Martin Freeman, James Nesbitt, Cate Blanchett, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Ian HolmElijah Wood, Ken Stott, Christopher Lee, Hugo Weaving, Andy Serkis, Peter Jackson, Martin Freeman, James Nesbitt, Cate Blanchett, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Ian Holm   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 49 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.53 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL1000296468BR', 'Director': 'Peter Jackson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Blu-ray, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 49 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 19, 2013', 'Actors': 'Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '2'}
I am biased because I am a recovering LOTR addict.  This was litter and funnier than LOTR.  I loved the dwarves!  I am pretty sure I have a secret dwarf crush on Fili and Kili (I don't actually know how to spell their names).  Bilbo and Smegel were both amusing.  I've already watched this twice!
It's A-mazing

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Consumption**: The user continues to prefer serialized content, with a focus on uninterrupted viewing experiences and narrative continuity. Their enjoyment of classic adaptations extends to animated series, reflecting a nostalgic appreciation for beloved characters and storytelling.
- **Viewing Languages**: Primarily engages with content in English, both audio and subtitles, maintaining openness to dubbed formats when necessary.
- **Purchase Behavior**: Demonstrates a willingness to invest in high-quality physical formats, with a particular preference for box sets that enable comprehensive viewing of entire series.
- **Quality Expectations**: Holds high standards for viewing quality, favoring well-produced content across various genres, including animation and family-friendly series that blend humor and adventure.
- **Emotional Engagement**: The user exhibits a strong emotional connection to characters and narratives, finding humor and relatability in their viewing choices, which enhances repeat viewing value.
- **Platform Preferences**: Favors online platforms for quick and seamless access, yet appreciates well-curated physical collections that mirror their viewing habits and interests in detailed narratives.

This user profile highlights a consistent tendency towards high-quality, accessible, and emotionally resonant content, with growing enthusiasm for classic animated series that align with their appreciation for character-driven storytelling.
